title: old diary type
content:
Please help with these. Any advice appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018180001im_/http:/typophile.com/files/diary3_6196.jpg)

 [‹ French Vogue magazine text typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018180001/http:/typophile.com/node/35918 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Cinematics blocky old school display face ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018180001/http:/typophile.com/node/35891 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jameslangdon

comments.content: Please give this a second look, I’m desperate!

Do you have any more bibliographic information? Very interesting that Sunday is noted with a fraktur. That seems historically archaic as if to say Sunday being a holy day is still set apart with a holy typeface.

What sort of “old” are you talking about here? This looks like something from the 1950s/1960s, and that would be sympathetic with the Sunday fractur.

The rest of the letters are vaguely Caslon ( [Rough](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018180001/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/caslon-rough/) is close-ish, except for the r), but the numbers aren’t anywhere near that....

It’s from 1952 and published in the UK. I have one other sample here, but it’s clearly a different face for the display size... does it give any clues?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071018180001im_/http:/typophile.com/files/diary2_6224.jpg)
